metadata.author: Victor Solé Ferioli
metadata.training_philosophy: Rotating emphasis approach with balanced volume, sustainable progression, and proper recovery periods
metadata.target_audience: Advanced trainees with 2+ years consistent training experience
key_principles: 15-20 sets per muscle group per week (emphasis weeks: 20-25 sets)
Progressive overload: +2-5kg per mesocycle on main lifts
True deload: Week 4 of each mesocycle (50% volume, 70% intensity)
2:1 pull to push ratio for shoulder health

specific_warmup.description: Before first compound exercise of each session

mesocycles.name: Foundation Phase
mesocycles.focus: Establishing baseline, learning movement patterns, building work capacity

days.name: Leg Emphasis Day

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.notes: Focus on landing softly, full hip extension

exercises.name: Back Squat
exercises.notes: Primary leg builder. Keep chest up, depth to parallel minimum

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Keep slight knee bend, hinge at hips, feel hamstring stretch

exercises.name: Walking Lunges (DB)
exercises.notes: Control descent, knee shouldn't pass toes excessively

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.notes: Feet shoulder-width, full ROM without lower back lifting

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise
exercises.notes: Full stretch at bottom, hold squeeze at top

days.cooldown: 5-10 min light stretching, foam rolling quads/hamstrings

exercises.name: Flat Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Retract scapula, bar to lower chest, elbows 45° angle

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press (Seated)
exercises.notes: Core tight, slight lean back, press to lockout

exercises.name: Cable Crossover (Mid Height)
exercises.notes: Slight bend in elbows, squeeze at midline

exercises.name: Lateral Raise (DB)
exercises.notes: Slight forward lean, thumbs up or neutral, raise to shoulder height

exercises.name: Tricep Rope Pushdown
exercises.notes: Elbows pinned, pull rope apart at bottom

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Pull to face level, external rotation at end

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollouts
exercises.notes: From knees if needed, full extension

exercises.name: Pull-Ups (Weighted if possible)
exercises.notes: Full ROM, chin over bar, control descent

exercises.name: Barbell Bent-Over Row
exercises.notes: Hip hinge position, row to lower chest, retract scapula

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.notes: Chest up, squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
exercises.notes: Wide grip, pull to upper chest, lean back slightly

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Critical for shoulder health, 2:1 pull to push ratio

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrugs
exercises.notes: Straight up and down, no rolling, hold squeeze

days.name: Complete Rest
activities: Focus on nutrition (1g protein per lb bodyweight)

days.name: Push Emphasis Day

exercises.name: Flat Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Primary push builder, focus on progressive overload

days.cooldown: Chest and shoulder stretches, pec doorway stretch

days.name: Pull Emphasis Day

exercises.name: Deadlift (Conventional)
exercises.notes: Primary pull builder. Focus on hip hinge, neutral spine

days.cooldown: Lat and upper back stretches, forearm stretches

cardio.notes: Great for glute activation and recovery

microcycles.notes: 50% volume (half the sets), 70% intensity (lighter weights), focus on technique and recovery

days.name: Light Full Body
days.notes: All weights at 70% of normal working weight

exercises.name: Back Squat
exercises.notes: 70% of normal weight, focus on form

days.name: Complete Rest
days.notes: Prepare for Mesocycle 2. Ensure sleep and nutrition are optimized

mesocycles.name: Strength Development Phase
mesocycles.focus: Progressive overload from Mesocycle 1, increased intensity, refined technique
mesocycles.progression_notes: +2-5kg on main compound lifts, +1-2kg on accessories, or +1-2 reps if weight cannot increase

microcycles.notes: Week 1 pattern repeated with 2-5kg added to all exercises from Mesocycle 1 Week 1
Push emphasis pattern with progressive overload from M1W2
Pull emphasis pattern with progressive overload from M1W3
Same deload protocol as Week 4, 50% volume, 70% intensity

mesocycles.name: Hypertrophy Focus Phase
mesocycles.focus: Continued progression, adding volume through additional reps or sets where appropriate
mesocycles.progression_notes: Continue +2-5kg on compounds, or increase to 4 sets where previously 3 sets, or add 1-2 reps

mesocycles.name: Peak Performance Phase
mesocycles.focus: Maximizing strength and muscle gains, preparing for next training cycle or testing
mesocycles.progression_notes: Final progression phase before reassessment. Consider testing 1RM after Week 16 deload

microcycles.notes: Final recovery week. Take assessments: photos, measurements, strength tests (optional 1RM testing), body composition. Plan next 16-week cycle.

nutrition_guidelines.timing: Pre-workout meal 2-3 hours before training, post-workout meal within 2 hours
nutrition_guidelines.hydration: Minimum 3L water daily, more on training days

essential: Whey protein as needed for protein goals

recovery_protocols.stress_management: Meditation, breathing exercises, adequate rest days
recovery_protocols.active_recovery: Light cardio, yoga, swimming on rest days
recovery_protocols.tissue_work: Foam rolling, massage, stretching 3-4x per week
recovery_protocols.deload_weeks: Every 4th week - mandatory 50% volume reduction, 70% intensity

progression_strategy.when_to_progress: When completing all prescribed reps with good form for 2 consecutive weeks
how_to_progress: If stalling: Add 1 set before increasing weight
If failing: Deload for 1 week, rebuild
progression_strategy.autoregulation: Use RPE/TR Intensity feedback. If consistently below target intensity, increase weight. If above and form suffers, maintain or reduce.

injury_prevention.warm_up_mandatory: Never skip warm-up protocol before heavy compounds
injury_prevention.form_over_ego: Reduce weight if form breaks down
injury_prevention.listen_to_body: Persistent pain = stop exercise, substitute or rest
injury_prevention.shoulder_health: Maintain 2:1 pull to push ratio, daily band pull-aparts (100 reps)
injury_prevention.lower_back_protection: Never combine heavy squats and heavy deadlifts same day, 48hr minimum between
injury_prevention.joint_health: Vary grip positions, include unilateral work, adequate rest periods

strength_testing.method: Work up to 3RM or 5RM on main lifts, calculate estimated 1RM
strength_testing.notes: Only test when feeling recovered and fresh

body_composition.consistency: Same time of day, same conditions, same scale/method

program_notes.philosophy: This program uses a hybrid rotating emphasis approach where each 4-week mesocycle contains 3 weeks of progressive training (Leg emphasis → Push emphasis → Pull emphasis) followed by a proper deload week. This allows for focused volume on specific muscle groups while maintaining balanced overall development and proper recovery.
program_notes.volume_justification: Emphasis days: 25-30 sets for primary muscle groups. Non-emphasis days: 15-20 sets. This is within optimal hypertrophy volume recommendations (10-20 sets per muscle per week), with emphasis weeks pushing slightly higher for advanced trainees.
program_notes.sustainability: Unlike the original superday approach with 50-60 sets, this program maintains sustainable volume that allows for consistent progression over 16 weeks without excessive fatigue or injury risk.
program_notes.customization: Advanced trainees may add 1-2 sets to emphasis days if recovery permits. Beginners should reduce all sets by 1 and focus on technique mastery.
program_notes.after_completion: After completing all 4 mesocycles (16 weeks), take a full week off or do light activity only, reassess goals, test strength, and begin a new training phase with adjusted weights based on new baseline.
